byline.original: By MICHAEL CORKERY and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

abstract: Suit filed by Scott Barrow against Brandon Woods nursing home in South Dartmouth, Mass, will be heard by state court in March, and case is likely to be test of legal strategy that could prevent nursing homes in United State from requiring their residents use arbitration instead of courts; Barrow's mother Elizabeth was murdered at Brandon Woods by her roommate, yet nursing home was protected by contract signed by Elizabeth Barrow that forced any dispute into private arbitration.

headline.print_headline: A Nursing Home Murder and a Family’s Arbitration Fight
headline.main: Pivotal Nursing Home Suit Raises a Simple Question: Who Signed the Contract?

keywords.value: Brandon Woods (South Dartmouth, Mass, Nursing Home)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A pending wrongful death lawsuit will test a new legal strategy to prevent nursing homes from requiring their residents to take disputes to arbitration.
lead_paragraph: A pending wrongful death lawsuit will test a new legal strategy to prevent nursing homes from requiring their residents to take disputes to arbitration.
